ArticleTitle.sentence: Epstein-Barr virus replicative gene transcription during de novo infection of human thymocytes: simultaneous early expression of BZLF-1 and its repressor RAZ.

AbstractText.sentence: Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) is known to infect B cells and epithelial cells.

event.clue: Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) is known to infect B cells and epithelial cells.
Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) is known to infect B cells and epithelial cells.

AbstractText.sentence: We and others have shown that EBV can also infect a subset of thymocytes.

event.clue: We and others have shown that EBV can also infect a subset of thymocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: Infection of thymocytes was accompanied by the appearance of linear EBV genome within 8 hr of infection.

event.clue: Infection of thymocytes was accompanied by the appearance of linear EBV genome within 8 hr of infection.
Infection of thymocytes was accompanied by the appearance of linear EBV genome within 8 hr of infection.

AbstractText.sentence: Circularization of the EBV genome was not detected.

event.clue: Circularization of the EBV genome was not detected.

AbstractText.sentence: This is in contrast to the infection in B cells where the genome can circularize within 24 hr of infection.

event.clue: This is in contrast to the infection in B cells where the genome can circularize within 24 hr of infection.
This is in contrast to the infection in B cells where the genome can circularize within 24 hr of infection.

AbstractText.sentence: The appearance of the BamHI ZLF-1 gene product, ZEBRA, by RT-PCR, was observed within 8 hr of infection.

event.clue: The appearance of the BamHI ZLF-1 gene product, ZEBRA, by RT-PCR, was observed within 8 hr of infection.

AbstractText.sentence: The appearance of a novel fusion transcript (RAZ), which comprised regions of the BZLF-1 locus and the adjacent BRLF-1 locus, was detected by RT-PCR.

event.clue: The appearance of a novel fusion transcript (RAZ), which comprised regions of the BZLF-1 locus and the adjacent BRLF-1 locus, was detected by RT-PCR.

AbstractText.sentence: ZEBRA protein was also identified in infected thymocytes by immunoprecipitation.

event.clue: ZEBRA protein was also identified in infected thymocytes by immunoprecipitation.
ZEBRA protein was also identified in infected thymocytes by immunoprecipitation.

AbstractText.sentence: In addition, we demonstrated that the EBNA-1 gene in infected thymocytes was transcribed from the Fp promoter, rather than from the Cp/Wp promoter which is used in latently infected B cells.

event.clue: In addition, we demonstrated that the EBNA-1 gene in infected thymocytes was transcribed from the Fp promoter, rather than from the Cp/Wp promoter which is used in latently infected B cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Transcripts encoding gp350/220, the major coat protein of EBV, were identified, but we did not find any evidence of transcription from the LMP-2A or EBER-1 loci in infected thymocytes.

event.clue: Transcripts encoding gp350/220, the major coat protein of EBV, were identified, but we did not find any evidence of transcription from the LMP-2A or EBER-1 loci in infected thymocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: These observations suggest that de novo EBV infection of thymocytes differs from infection of B cells.

event.clue: These observations suggest that de novo EBV infection of thymocytes differs from infection of B cells.
These observations suggest that de novo EBV infection of thymocytes differs from infection of B cells.

AbstractText.sentence: The main difference is that with thymocytes, no evidence could be found that the virus ever circularizes.

event.clue: The main difference is that with thymocytes, no evidence could be found that the virus ever circularizes.

AbstractText.sentence: Rather, EBV remains in a linear configuration from which replicative genes are transcribed.

event.clue: Rather, EBV remains in a linear configuration from which replicative genes are transcribed.
Rather, EBV remains in a linear configuration from which replicative genes are transcribed.
